title: Consulting Proposal Generator
description: Write winning proposals for high-ticket clients
prompt:
Write a consulting proposal for [PROJECT].

Client: [CLIENT]
Problem: [PROBLEM]

Structure:
1. Situation Appraisal (We understand your pain)
2. Objectives (What success looks like)
3. Methodology (How we will do it)
4. Timeline & Deliverables
5. Investment (Fees)
6. Terms

Tone: Professional, authoritative, value-focused.

title: SWOT Analysis Builder
prompt:
Perform a SWOT analysis for [COMPANY/PROJECT].

Context: [INDUSTRY/SITUATION]

Grid:
- Strengths (Internal/Positive)
- Weaknesses (Internal/Negative)
- Opportunities (External/Positive)
- Threats (External/Negative)

Strategic Recommendations: How to use Strengths to capture Opportunities and mitigate Threats.

title: Change Management Plan
prompt:
Create a Change Management Plan for [CHANGE, e.g., New Software Rollout].

Stakeholders: [Employees, Managers, IT]

Phases (ADKAR Model):
1. Awareness (Why change?)
2. Desire (What's in it for me?)
3. Knowledge (Training)
4. Ability (Support/Resources)
5. Reinforcement (Sustaining the change)

Communication plan for each phase.

title: Workshop Agenda Designer
prompt:
Design a 4-hour workshop agenda for [TOPIC].

Goal: [OUTCOME, e.g., Define Strategy]
Attendees: [WHO]

Agenda:
- Icebreaker (15m)
- Module 1: Context/Learning (45m)
- Activity 1: Brainstorming (30m)
- Break (15m)
- Module 2: Selection/Refinement (45m)
- Activity 2: Action Planning (45m)
- Closing/Next Steps (15m)

Include materials needed.

title: Market Research Brief
prompt:
Write a brief for a market research project.

Topic: [MARKET/TREND]
Goal: [Validate product idea/Understand competitor]

Questions to Answer:
1. Market Size (TAM)
2. Growth Trends (CAGR)
3. Key Competitors
4. Customer Segments
5. Regulatory Environment

Sources to target: Industry reports, interviews, surveys.

title: Executive Summary Writer
description: Condense complex reports into one-page summaries
prompt:
Summarize this report into a 1-page Executive Summary.

Audience: CEO/Board

Report Content:
[PASTE CONTENT OR KEY POINTS]

Structure:
1. The Ask/Decision needed
2. Background (Brief)
3. Key Findings (Bullet points)
4. Financial Impact
5. Recommendation

Keep it under 500 words.

title: Project Post-Mortem Template
description: Learn from past projects to improve future ones
prompt:
Facilitate a project post-mortem (retrospective).

Project: [NAME]
Outcome: [Success/Failure/Mixed]

Questions:
1. What went well? (Keep doing)
2. What went wrong? (Stop doing)
3. What was lucky? (Don't rely on next time)
4. What was missing? (Start doing)

Action items for next project.
